articles.headline: Discordant Financial Messages From China Spur Global Unease
articles.snippet: Conflicting signals about the direction of the country’s economy are creating volatility in world markets and causing consternation among policy makers.
articles.abstract: Conflicting signals about the direction of the country’s economy are creating volatility in world markets and causing consternation among policy makers.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China’s bungled stock market bailout was a significant setback to its decades-long efforts to build a modern financial system.

articles.headline: Mistrial Is Declared in Dewey & LeBoeuf Case
articles.snippet: The jurors had already acquitted three former leaders of the law firm on dozens of charges and said they were “hopelessly deadlocked” on the rest.
articles.abstract: The jurors had already acquitted three former leaders of the law firm on dozens of charges and said they were “hopelessly deadlocked” on the rest.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the rare trial that had captured the attention of lawyers across the country: a criminal case against some of their own, the top leaders of a once large and prominent law firm.

articles.headline: Many Low-Income Workers Say ‘No’ to Health Insurance
articles.snippet: The Affordable Care Act requires employers with more than 50 full-time workers to offer insurance, but many find few low-income employees will buy it.
articles.abstract: The Affordable Care Act requires employers with more than 50 full-time workers to offer insurance, but many find few low-income employees will buy it.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, N.C. — When Billy Sewell began offering health insurance this year to 600 service workers at the Golden Corral restaurants that he owns, he wondered nervously how many would buy it. Adding hundreds of employees to his plan would cost him more than $1 million — a hit he wasn’t sure his low-margin business could afford.

articles.headline: Anheuser-Busch InBev Aims Its Tax-Trimming Skills at SABMiller
articles.snippet: Anheuser-Busch InBev receives friendly treatment from Belgian tax officials, and its global power as a tax negotiator might grow if it merges with SABMiller.
articles.abstract: Anheuser-Busch InBev receives friendly treatment from Belgian tax officials, and its global power as a tax negotiator might grow if it merges with SABMiller.
articles.lead_paragraph: LEUVEN, Belgium — The sweet, earthy aroma from the brewery here is inescapable. The Stella Artois logos are hard to miss at the sprawling factory near the headquarters of the company, which employs thousands of workers across the country.

articles.headline: Migrant Suffocations in Truck Near Hungary Reveal Tactics of Smugglers
articles.snippet: The deaths of 71 migrants in a meat truck found in Austria raised questions about the cruelty of the smugglers and the desperation of their clients.
articles.abstract: The deaths of 71 migrants in a meat truck found in Austria raised questions about the cruelty of the smugglers and the desperation of their clients.
articles.lead_paragraph: NICKELSDORF, Austria — Austrian police officers found pungent fluid dripping from the back door of a meat truck that had been abandoned on a highway near the Hungarian border. Counting the tangled and decomposing bodies inside took the authorities more than a day.

articles.headline: Drug Makers Sidestep Barriers on Pricing
articles.snippet: Use of mail-order specialty pharmacies seems to be a new way for drug makers to try to keep the health system paying for high-priced drugs.
articles.abstract: Use of mail-order specialty pharmacies seems to be a new way for drug makers to try to keep the health system paying for high-priced drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The pain reliever Duexis is a combination of two old drugs, the generic equivalents of Motrin and Pepcid.

articles.headline: Fragile Baltimore Struggles to Heal After Deadly Police Encounter
articles.snippet: Six months since the death of Freddie Gray after a police encounter, the city is on edge as it seeks new leadership and the trials of six police officers approach.
articles.abstract: Six months since the death of Freddie Gray after a police encounter, the city is on edge as it seeks new leadership and the trials of six police officers approach.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — The Rev. Donté L. Hickman Sr., pastor of one of this city’s largest African-American churches, wrapped up a fiery, foot-stomping sermon one recent Sunday with a somber request. “Pray for the city and the mayor,” he urged his congregation, reminding them that Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake had decided not to run again.

articles.headline: Michael Bloomberg for President? Wall Street’s Drums Are Beating
articles.snippet: The business community’s interest in a presidential run by the media and data magnate and former mayor of New York has been getting stronger.
articles.abstract: The business community’s interest in a presidential run by the media and data magnate and former mayor of New York has been getting stronger.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the past several months, Michael R. Bloomberg has fielded the same phone call over and over again from his Wall Street friends: Why don’t you run for president?

articles.headline: The Myth of Welfare’s Corrupting Influence on the Poor
articles.snippet: Studies rebut a long-cherished belief in America, on the right and left, that welfare encourages bad behavior by the poor.
articles.abstract: Studies rebut a long-cherished belief in America, on the right and left, that welfare encourages bad behavior by the poor.
